publications.title: ՏՏ Դատաստան
publications.description: Ի հարգանքս բոլոր նրանց, ովքեր սիրով են կատարում իրենց գործը։

publications.title: IT HEAVEN
publications.description: “IT Heaven” imagines the afterlife for IT workers: Hell mirrors toxic workplaces, Heaven offers freedom and fulfillment. Through interviews, it critiques the ethical impact of tech, showing that true guidance comes from conscience, not rules.

publications.title: Մեղսավոր ծրագրավորող
publications.description: Այս հոդվածում անդրադարձել եմ պատճառաբանությունների, որոնց հանդիպել եմ, որոնք հենց իմ մոտ են ի հայտ եկել, կամ որոնցով ուրիշներն են արդարացել կապված վատ կոդ գրելու հետ։

publications.title: GUILTY programmer
publications.description: “Guilty Programmer” explains why experienced developers often fail to write clean code. Reasons include lack of confidence in a new team, fear of breaking legacy code, tight deadlines, frequent requirement changes, and avoiding conflicts in reviews. Overconfidence or low motivation can also lead to poor-quality code. Ultimately, clean coding depends not just on skill, but on environment, discipline, and team culture.

publications.title: WARRIOR’S CODE
publications.description: “Warrior’s Code” portrays a developer as a disciplined warrior navigating the challenges of programming. Through the metaphorical journey across heap, stack, event loop, and error handler, the story highlights his rules: paying for tools, managing time via high- and medium-productivity periods, automating repetitive tasks with helper scripts, and staying engaged to avoid boredom. It emphasizes professionalism, foresight, and thoughtful work habits as keys to success in development.

publications.title: ՄԱՐՏԻԿԻ ԿԱՆՈՆՆԵՐԸ
publications.description: Վճարիր գործիքներիդ համար, Բարձր արտադրողականության ժամանակահատված, Ստեղծիր օգնականներ, Միշտ ունեցիր անելիք։

publications.title: IP Rotation with NodeJS and Heroku
publications.description: The article explains how to perform IP rotation for data scraping using NodeJS and Heroku. A script makes HTTP requests to a list of URLs and handles rate-limit errors by restarting the Heroku dyno, which automatically changes its IP address. It details the setup of the NodeJS script, use of the Heroku API for dyno restarts, configuration of environment variables, and deployment steps to ensure continuous operation despite IP blocks.

publications.title: Heroku: Մեկ NodeJS ծրագրի բազմաթիվ IP հասցեներ
publications.description: Հոդվածում նկարագրվում է մի մեթոդ, որով կարելի է փոփոխել server-ի IP հասցեն անհրաժեշտությունից ելնելով։

publications.title: Testing Asynchronous Events Using Manual Promise
publications.description: The article describes testing asynchronous events in a NodeJS. To handle a certain event, a custom ManualPromise class was created, allowing tests to await and control the event’s resolution. This approach enabled integration tests with Mocha to reliably pass or fail based on the event outcome.

publications.title: Powerful Aggregation Framework of MongoDB
publications.description: The article explains the powerful aggregation framework of MongoDB, which processes and transforms data through a sequence of pipeline stages. It covers key stages like $lookup for joins, $unwind and $group for categorization, $bucketAuto for automatic grouping, $facet for multiple pipelines, $geoNear for location queries, $graphLookup for recursive searches, and $out for storing results. Each stage is illustrated with examples, showing how to manipulate and analyze data efficiently within MongoDB.

publications.title: Programming Prolongs Life
publications.description: In this short article I shared my thoughts about creativity and how it's related to programming.

publications.title: Monolithic Apps With The Intent Of Microservices
publications.description: Microservices are great but they can complicate your work when you're not sure what your app will become eventually. Sometimes having monolithic app is better choice.

publications.title: Cloud Services VS Fake Startup Ideas
publications.description: An article about how to use free tiers of cloud services to release MVPs of your startup ideas.

publications.title: Management of environment files using CircleCI contexts
publications.description: In this article I have described a mechanism which allows to facilitate management of .env files by using CircleCI contexts and a little bit scripting.

publications.title: Six tips to speed up Node.js Apps development
publications.description: This article highlights the six most important tips I have learned by analyzing my previous projects from the last few years. In it, I have compiled a list of recommendations to help in facilitating the development process of node.js apps. There aren't only six tips, of course, I've only listed the six most important ones according to my experience.

publications.title: [cybersecurity] Login with social account
publications.description: Often in various websites and applications we see social login feature. Let's try to understand,if there is an information risk arising from that and ways of protecting our personal information.

publications.title: ՄՈՒՏՔ ԱՅԼ ԿԱՅՔԻ ՄԻՋՈՑՈՎ
publications.description: Հաճախ տարբեր կայքերում և հավելվածներում կարելի է հանդիպել «Մուտք այլ կայքի միջոցով» կոճակների։ Փորձենք հասկանալ ինչի համար են նախատեսված այդ կոճակները, դրանց օգտակարությունը, դրանցից բխող տեղեկատվական վտանգները և այդ վտանգներից պաշտպանվելու եղանակները։

publications.title: Adventures of Promise in Bluebird world
publications.description: Once upon a time a boy named Promise decided to go travel in one of the famous worlds in his reality. Article is about several useful methods of bluebird npm package.

publications.title: Cursor in MongoDB
publications.description: The article explains the basics of MongoDB cursors, which represent a set of documents matching a query.

companies.title: Software Engineer

details.label: Main Stack
details.value: JavaScript, NodeJS, Express, MongoDB, Apache Kafka

companies.description:
In this company, I worked on a large Esports-related project and was one of the first developers on the team. The project was a portal for Esports gaming results and statistics, where we fetched and processed data from external APIs for popular games such as Dota 2, CS:GO, and League of Legends.

This was my first experience with microservices architecture, where I gained extensive related skills. By the time I left, the application consisted of more than fifty services communicating with each other via the Apache Kafka messaging system.

The project involved numerous challenges, including data scraping, rate limiting, data synchronization, and other complex processes, which we worked actively to resolve.

companies.title: Senior Software Engineer

details.label: Main Stack
details.value: JavaScript, TypeScript, NodeJS, Express, Nats, Redis, MongoDB, Micro-services

details.label: Reason of leaving
details.value: Didn't want to change my technology stack by switching to Ruby.

companies.description:
I worked on three projects in this company, two of which were successfully completed, while the third was a legacy project that I decided not to continue with.

The first project was a banking application that allowed users to manage personal bank accounts through various communication channels such as voice calls, SMS, and chatbots. I integrated the back-end with an external API that enabled account operations, and although the application was relatively small, it was implemented using a microservices architecture.

The second project was an auction web application for buying and selling gold bars. I worked independently on the back-end and implemented a monolithic architecture designed to be easily converted into microservices if needed.

The third project was a document processing system that used OCR to parse and annotate scanned documents. As it was a legacy application written in Ruby, it required me to change my technology stack, which I decided not to pursue.
